meanings.definition: A type of traditional Irish boat.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen used curaghs to navigate the rough waters.
meanings.sent2: Curaghs are commonly seen along the Irish coastline.
meanings.sent3: The curious seal hitched a ride on the sturdy curaghs.
meanings.sent4: The fleet of curaghs danced gracefully on the shimmering sea.
meanings.sent5: The colorful curaghs bobbed up and down in the harbor.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'curagh', referring to more than one of these boats.
meanings.sent1: Visitors marveled at the collection of curaghs displayed at the museum.
meanings.sent2: The harbor was filled with curaghs of various sizes and colors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagulls perched on top of the clustered curaghs.
meanings.sent4: Under the moonlight, the row of curaghs looked like a string of pearls.
meanings.sent5: The auctioneer announced the sale of the historic curaghs.
